summary.para: From a font set, create a collection of fonts grouped into families.

param.name: fontSet
param.para: A set of fonts to use to build the collection.

param.name: fontFamilyModel
param.para: How to group families in the collection.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font collection object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Creates a reference to a specific font instance within a file.

param.name: fontFile
param.para: A user-provided font file representing the font face.

param.name: faceIndex
param.para: The zero-based index of a font face in cases when the font file contains a collection of font faces. If the font file contains a single face, then set this value to zero.

param.name: fontSimulations
param.para: Font face simulation flags for algorithmic emboldening and italicization.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: fontFaceReference
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font face reference object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Creates a font resource, given a font file and a face index.

param.name: fontFile
param.para: A user-provided font file representing the font face.

param.name: faceIndex
param.para: The zero-based index of a font face in cases when the font file contains a collection of font faces. If the font file contains a single face, then set this value to zero.

param.name: fontResource
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font resource object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Creates an empty font set builder, ready to add font instances to, and create a custom font set.

param.name: fontSetBuilder
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font set builder object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Creates a text format object used for text layout.

param.name: fontFamilyName
param.para: Name of the font family from the collection.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: Font collection. Use nullptr to indicate the system font collection.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: fontSize
param.para: Logical size of the font in DIP units.

param.name: textFormat
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created text format object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: If fontCollection is nullptr, then the system font collection is used, grouped by typographic family name () without downloadable fonts.

summary.para: Retrieves a collection of fonts, grouped into families.

param.name: includeDownloadableFonts
param.para: true if you want to include downloadable fonts. false if you only want locally installed fonts.

param.name: fontFamilyModel
param.para: How to group families in the collection.

param.name: fontCollection
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font collection object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Retrieves the set of system fonts.

param.name: includeDownloadableFonts
param.para: true if you want to include downloadable fonts. false if you only want locally installed fonts.

param.name: fontSet
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to the font set object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: This interface represents a factory object from which all DirectWrite objects are created. IDWriteFactory6 adds new facilities for working with fonts and font resources.
